meanings.definition: A sudden and violent change or reaction
meanings.sent1: The revulsions in the weather caught us by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The revulsions in the plot of the movie kept us on the edge of our seats.
meanings.sent3: The revulsions in the recipe made everyone's taste buds revolt.
meanings.sent4: The revulsions in the political landscape shook the nation to its core.
meanings.sent5: The revulsions in the music created a dramatic shift in the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or aversion
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her revulsions towards the slimy texture of the food.
meanings.sent2: His revulsions towards violence made him a pacifist.
meanings.sent3: The revulsions towards the creepy crawly bugs were evident on her face.
meanings.sent4: The revulsions towards the idea were palpable in the room.
meanings.sent5: The revulsions towards the smell were overwhelming and made her gag.

meanings.definition: The act of pulling or tearing away from something
meanings.sent1: The revulsions of the bandage from the wound were painful.
meanings.sent2: The revulsions of the Velcro from the fabric were loud.
meanings.sent3: The revulsions of the sticker from the paper left a sticky residue.
meanings.sent4: The revulsions of the magnet from the metal were strong.
meanings.sent5: The revulsions of the tape from the box revealed its contents.
